ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were arguing with and speaking a goods.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.4_0: “These monks from the group of six are shameless;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.5_0: it’s not possible to argue with them.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.6_0: And the monks from the group of six said this about them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.10_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.11_0: “How can the monks from the group of six eavesdrop on monks they are arguing and disputing?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.12_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.15_0: “... Foolish men, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.16_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.17_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.18.1_0: ‘If a monk eavesdrops on monks who are arguing and disputing, thinking, “I’ll hear what they say,” and he does so only for this reason and no other, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.8_0: who are engaged in a legal issue.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.10_0: if he is on his way to eavesdrop, thinking, “After hearing what they say, I’ll accuse them,” “... I’ll remind them,” “... I’ll counter-accuse them,” “... I’ll counter-remind them,” “... I’ll humiliate them,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.11_0: Wherever he stands to see it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.12_0: If he is walking behind while walking, and he thinks, “I’ll die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.13_0: Wherever he stands to see it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.14_0: If he is walking in front of someone, and he slows down with the intention to eavesdrop, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.15_0: Wherever he stands to see it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.16_0: if the army comes to where the monk is standing, sitting, or lying down, he should be deposited, saying: “This monk is unshakable,” or she should clear him, “Whoever dies,” he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.17_0: He does so only for this reason and no other:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.18_0: there is no other reason for eavesdropping.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.1_0: If it is one who is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he eavesdrops on him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.2_0: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he eavesdrops on him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.3_0: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he eavesdrops on him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.4_0: if she eavesdrops on one who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.5_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.6_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.7_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.3.2_0: if he goes, thinking, “After hearing what they say, I’ll refrain,” “... I’ll abstain,” “... I’ll resolve it,” “... I’ll free myself;”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.3.4_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.3.5_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on eavesdropping, is finished.
